content: --जः ‘twice-born’ {1} a man of any of the first three castes of the Hiṇdus (a Brāhmaṇa, Kṣatriya or Vaiśya); see <ls>Y. 1. 39.</ls> {2} a Brāhmaṇa (over whom the Saṃskāras or purificatory rites are performed); जन्मना ब्राह्मणो ज्ञेयः संस्कारैर्द्विज उच्यते. {3} any oviparous animal, such as a bird, snake, fish &c.; स तमानंदमविंदत द्विजः <ls>N. 2. 1</ls>; <ls>Ś. 5. 21</ls>; <ls>R. 12. 22</ls>; <ls>Mu. 1. 11</ls>; <ls>Ms. 5. 17.</ls> {4} a tooth; कीर्णं द्विजानां गणैः <ls>Bh. 1. 13</ls> (where द्विज means ‘a Brāhmaṇa’ also).
